item.title: UN says Israeli strike killed six of its Gaza staff
item.description: At least 18 people were reportedly killed in the strike, which Israel says targeted Hamas fighters.

item.title: Trump's message of American decline resonates with pivotal voters
item.description: Kamala Harris rattled her rival at the debate, but he's still winning in Michigan on issues that may decide election.

item.title: Jon Bon Jovi praised for talking woman off bridge
item.description: The US singer was in the Nashville area shooting a music video on the pedestrian bridge.

item.title: Soaring cost of King’s Guards' real fur bearskin caps revealed
item.description: Bearskin caps worn by soldiers outside Buckingham Palace cost more than £2,000 each, says MOD.

item.title: ‘I thought my life was over’: Escaping the sextortion scammers
item.description: John was left feeling suicidal after he was blackmailed over an intimate photo. He is one of a growing number of sextortion victims.

item.title: Swift makes MTV history while Katy Perry sparkles
item.description: Taylor Swift becomes the most-awarded artist in MTV history, while Katy Perry gets the night's main prize.

item.title: Knife wholesaler surrenders 35,000 'zombie' blades
item.description: The company, some of whose knives have been used in fatal attacks, will receive £10 per knife.

item.title: Strictly wins TV award after months of allegations
item.description: The show gets some welcome good news at the National Television Awards after its recent controversies.

item.title: Former Peruvian leader Alberto Fujimori dies at 86
item.description: The ex-president, who was convicted of human rights abuses and corruption, dies of tongue cancer.

item.title: Data centres to be given same 'critical' status as NHS and power grid
item.description: Critical national infrastructure status means they will get extra government support during emergencies.

item.title: Banks, chemists and pubs lead High Street closures
item.description: Chemists, pubs and banks made up half of High Street closures in the first six months of 2024, data suggests.

item.title: 'We eat on the floor’: Inside the guesthouse where everyone is homeless
item.description: A no-fault evictions ban will come in next summer, but thousands of families are already stuck in limbo.

item.title: The Papers: 'Biggest NHS reform' coming after 'damning' report
item.description: Most of the newspapers focus on the major report into the state of the NHS being published on Thursday.

item.title: Parents' transplant plea: 'One more infection and we could lose our boy'
item.description: Two-year-old Zachary Bradford could die in weeks if a donor cannot be found.

item.title: Five trends to look out for at London Fashion Week
item.description: This year's event promises an exciting mix of vivid colours, creative patterns, and attention-grabbing accessories.

item.title: Families cling to hope in Belarus after first release of political prisoners
item.description: Dozens of prisoners were freed unexpectedly this summer, now relatives are hoping more will follow.

item.title: Why West has limited Ukraine's use of its missiles
item.description: Western states have long been cautious about allowing Ukraine to use their missiles against Russia.

item.title: What the world thought of US debate
item.description: How the Harris-Trump debate was seen from Putin's Kremlin, Ukraine's frontlines and Taliban-run Afghanistan.

item.title: National parkland in public hands 'would help nature'
item.description: Campaigners call for national parks to be given new powers to buy private land and protect habitats.

item.title: Self-medicating gorillas may hold new drugs clues
item.description: Plants eaten by wild gorillas have medicinal properties that could be harnessed in drug discovery, say scientists.

item.title: Post Office victim criticises government on payouts as drama wins award
item.description: A postmaster portrayed in ITV's Post Office drama says many were still waiting to be paid compensation.

item.title: Australia strips officers' medals for war crimes culture
item.description: Senior commanders within the defence force are accused of overseeing an unchecked "warrior culture".

item.title: Nurses working in fear: BBC visits mpox epicentre
item.description: The BBC visits a clinic at the epicentre of the outbreak where the rate of infections is increasing.

item.title: Churchill photo stolen in Canada discovered in Italy
item.description: The theft from a hotel, which occurred sometime around Christmas 2022, took months for anyone to discover.

item.title: Watch: King surprised by 'very healing' hug with rugby players
item.description: King Charles laughed after accepting the surprise offer from a player on New Zealand's women's team.

item.title: Download now
item.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: The Harris VS Trump Debate... and a Taylor Swift Endorsement!
item.description: And why is "THEY'RE EATING THE DOGS" trending on X?

item.title: A Commons Duel on Winter Fuel
item.description: And, another candidate is voted out of the Tory leadership race.

item.title: McLaren ask Piastri to back Norris title bid
item.description: McLaren are to prioritise Lando Norris over team-mate Oscar Piastri in their bid to win both Formula 1 world championships this year, team principal Andrea Stella tells BBC Sport.

item.title: New-look England beaten by Australia in first T20
item.description: England slump to a 28-run defeat by Australia in the first T20 international at Utilita Bowl.

item.title: 'It was like a non-league team asking Man Utd for a match'
item.description: The Solheim Cup is a revolutionary tournament born out of the success of a revolutionary putter.

item.title: Ronaldo criticises Ten Hag & says Man Utd must 'rebuild everything'
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo says Manchester United must "rebuild everything" in order to compete for the biggest prizes in club football again.

item.title: England's Carsley plays down 'impossible job' tag
item.description: Being England boss is not the "impossible job" but "a really good one", says interim boss Lee Carsley.

item.title: Head hits 30 off Curran over
item.description: Travis Head hits Sam Curran for 30 in a single thrilling over as England take on Australia in the first T20 at Utilita Bowl, Southampton.

item.title: Anger as appeal against killer's release is denied
item.description: Tom Sisley says his family is angry and fearful over the decision to release his sister's killer.

item.title: Ministers to meet UK chancellor to discuss budget
item.description: The first and deputy first ministers will travel to London to meet UK chancellor.

item.title: Parents' transplant plea: 'One more infection and we could lose our boy'
item.description: Two-year-old Zachary Bradford could die in weeks if a donor cannot be found.

item.title: Miles back as minister after ousting Gething
item.description: Ex-first minister Mark Drakeford also gets permanent job in Eluned Morgan's cabinet reshuffle.
